links.title: The 'every man' Model 3 Tesla comes with a catch
links.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk handed over first 30 Model 3 cars to employee buyers But $35,000 is just the bare bones cost, with any option pushing the price up past $40,000 Outside the Fremont, California factory, Musk showed off the $35,000 cars Musk said he's 'confident it'll be the best car in its class, gasoline or not' The new 'every man' Model 3 Tesla revealed this week for $35,000 may just be technicality, with even the most basic options pushing the price past $40,000.

links.description: Tesla Inc ( TSLA) reports on Wednesday after the close. Our earnings estimates for the second quarter are more than $1.00 below the street. We had previously said that we had a $400 target on April 4th when the share price was below $300.

links.title: Jul-31-2017 - Market Recap and Next Day Review - Weekend Edition
links.description: This past week we saw the PC ratio identify a drop in the markets two days in advance. We also saw measured bullish and bearish targets achieved in the $DJI and $DJT respectively. Our volatility indicator triggered a Caution Buy at this time as we patiently wait to see if a new buy will be triggered.

links.title: Tesla Announced the Cost of Its Solar Roof
links.description: Just under six months after announcing its Solar Roof, Tesla has finally put a price tag on those eco-friendly solar tiles that look like the real thing - and they're actually really affordable.
